definition: out-of-body experience
quick/alert/efficacious/effective/to come true/spirit/departed soul/coffin
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
reckless/extremely daring
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to make a concession/to be accommodating
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to miss/to yearn day and night
to withdraw/to hole up
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
